events.title: Vasco da Gama Arrives in Calicut, India
events.description: Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama reaches Calicut (now Kozhikode), India, establishing a sea route from Europe to Asia.
events.significance: This event marks the beginning of direct maritime trade between Europe and Asia, influencing global trade and colonialism.

events.title: Invention of the First Patent System in the United States
events.description: The first U.S. patent was granted to Samuel Hopkins for a process of making potash, establishing the U.S. patent system.
events.significance: It laid the foundation for protecting intellectual property, encouraging innovation and technological growth in America.

events.title: Germany Declares War on Russia, Escalating World War I
events.description: Germany formally declares war on Russia, marking a significant escalation in the outbreak of World War I.
events.significance: This declaration intensified the conflict, leading to widespread involvement of world powers in the war.

events.title: The Civil Rights Act is Signed into U.S. Law
events.description: President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964, outlawing discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.
events.significance: A landmark legislation in the struggle for equality, it helped end segregation and promoted equal opportunity.

events.title: Dissolution of the Warsaw Pact Announced
events.description: The member states of the Warsaw Pact announce that the alliance will cease to function, effectively dissolving it.
events.significance: The end of this military alliance marked the winding down of Cold War tensions and shifted geopolitical dynamics in Europe.
